intro: Alchemilla anisiaca f. podophylla, commonly known as the sweet alchemilla, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
